lexUnit.name: unfair.a

corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

lexUnit.definition: COD: not based on or showing fairness; unjust.

sentence.text: Of course I 'm being most unfair , but that 's a reader 's prerogative .
The law is therefore most unfair to victims of negligence ; in limiting them in this way it totally ignores the reality of the situation .
I think these kind of comments are most unfair , as Andrew has a very exciting fast court game , and he is still more than capable of producing some good results .
That would be most unfair and unfortunate , and I am sure would not be what my right hon. Friend wishes .
` It 's most unfair of the Labour Party to have imposed a burden such as this on a man of John Scott 's age , " he says .
This could be quite unfair .
I 'm sure he 's in there somewhere , surrounded by a quite unfair bevy of beauties .
It represents totally unfair competition , not only to Tennis World but also to Tennis Magazine .
This image might be totally unfair .
` That point about the core business is very unfair , " he says .
It was a very unfair portrayal of you .
` You know , darling , " Louise said , as she was tying her scarf , ` you 're very unfair to yourself and your mother .
` Just tired , " said Julia , burying her immediate and very unfair jealousy in sympathy .
` It seems unfair that a few farmers should have to carry the cost of the consequences of what is after all a national policy .
The judges ' handling of the competition seems to have been inconsistent and conspicuously unfair .
This , however , seems a little unfair to Matza .
It seemed outrageously unfair that after so long she could not have him to herself and she hoped that his lodger would be tactful enough to leave them in peace during her visit .
It seems very unfair to leave her hoping when there is no hope . "
It seems a bit unfair to people who can not afford to update their computer every 12 months .
If a common agreement blankets all competitors , however , none can secure an unfair advantage by undercutting the labour standards .

The lawbreaker has disturbed this equilibrium of equality and gained an unfair advantage over those of us who have behaved well and abided by the rules .
A great many opportunities to accumulate wealth or power are available to these institutions and individuals and they may take an unfair advantage of the situation .

If unfair overseas competition causes them to dwindle , holes appear in the fabric .

But the main problems appear to be with residential home owners , who have threatened legal action over allegedly unfair contracts drawn by some SSDs .
A TEACHER who was sacked because some of his lessons were said to be too sexually explicit has won 12,000 compensation for unfair dismissal .
In the context of unfair dismissal it is not your personal situation that is to be considered , but that of an employee in your category .
Individual citizens and minority communities themselves need protection against the power of the state and against discrimination and unfair treatment .

` But I feel it 's a bit unfair that he should try to use a few Press photographs as an excuse ! "
Mr Connor said it was unfair that she be refused the help now being offered to others .
It is not unfair when my horse loses , even if I was confident , with good reason , that it would win .
Although it may be unfair to criticize the laudable and worthwhile efforts in this direction over many years , the focus has probably been rather narrow .
It is unfair to expect an adult dog to appreciate that such actions are no longer welcomed if you have allowed them since it was a puppy .
It would be unfair to make too many demands of the statements I have quoted .
` But it is unfair of people to blame industry for all the filth when sewage discharge was similarly exempt from legislation .
It is not , however , automatically unfair to dismiss an employee while he remains eligible for sick pay under the rules of the scheme .
It is a touch unfair to use hindsight to criticise what faced an eager hungry young Welsh unknown in the piranha-filled goldfish bowl of Hollywood in the early Fifties .
It is , of course , a little unfair to make a comparison between Ayers Rock and Bullens Creek .
It was so damned unfair that she would never see them .
Life could be unfair for some .

If parents ' distaste for a child 's friend is really caused by social and class differences it would usually be unfair of them to interfere .
It was unfair of me ; I should n't have interrupted . "
It is a bit unfair of Opposition Members to ask Ministers to make judgments on or second guess what tribunals do .

It 's unfair to you , and unfair to Alison .
I know that I 'm being unfair to you and to Virginia , but what I feel for you -- what I have always felt for you -- has made a weakling of me . "
I also feel it would be unfair to my daughter to have an affair with a woman .
But I have been unfair to the typists .
The hon. Gentleman is being unfair to the North sea supplies industry .

It was so unfair !
